before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"l6ue","text":"Check the following before the session is started:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp5bp","text":"Microscope LN2 tank at least 20% full.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cm07","text":"Smart EPU Software.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q7g0","text":"Carbon cross-grid inside the microscope for alignments. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asonu","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

creator.name: Amalia Villagran Suarez
creator.affiliation: Department of Cellular and Molecular Medicine, University of California, San Diego, La Jolla, CA 92093

affiliations.affiliation: Department of Cellular and Molecular Medicine, University of California, San Diego, La Jolla, CA 92093

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"88jq7","text":"This quick guide provides key minimal steps for preparing the Microscope/EPU for single-particle data collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apkhs","text":"Please note that this guide might be slightly different for each microscope and facility. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8lk8c","text":"Load samples into the microscope. Slot 1 is reversed for the carbon cross-grid which is used for alignments. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clk4u","text":"To load, add grids into the cassette at LN2 temperatures and transfer into the NanoCab filled with LN2.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6l3ik","text":" Transfer NanoCab into the microscope, load grids and remove the NanoCab.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tlfj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f69el","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5ffdb","text":"When loading grids, make sure the clip side faces opposite from the direction of loading, this prevents lose-clip grids from falling inside the microscope. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ema3s","text":"Check NanoCab after loading grids. If the cassette is present, add more LN2 and try to load again. If cassette is not loading, contact your facility manager for assistance. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67sia","text":"Do inventory of grids using TEMUI when temperatures \u003c~100Kelvin, indicated by the switch of color from red to green.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9i9ds","text":"While inventory is going, go to an empty hole in the carbon-cross grid using the Preparation Tab on EPU.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19a88","text":" Acquire image using the atlas magnification to visualize an empty hole and move to that area using right click and pressing “move here” or “move/acquire”. \n ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":19},{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78pu6","text":"Switch to data acquisition magnification using the Preparation Tab on EPU and load the preferred magnification, press SET to send it to the microscope. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":30},{"style":"italic","offset":10,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"377jr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ipru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bvthp","text":"Magnification and pixel size will vary depending on the microscope and camera.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65bme","text":"In the same Tab press Measure to check the dose and change it to your preferred dose. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73uk4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rnm0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8g3q6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":30,"offset":46,"style":"bold"},{"length":30,"offset":46,"style":"italic"}],"key":"84h4g","text":"If the dose is off, re-center the beam at the data acquisition magnification using TEMUI, by opening the column valves to see the beam while centering. Once centered measure the dose again. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":31,"style":"sup"}],"key":"5tqfv","text":"Our preferred dose is 50-55 e/Å2. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1353j","text":"Skip this step if the microscope does not have an energy filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"davf1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90uru","text":"Go to the program \"Sherpa\" and select the Energy Filter tab.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70a88","text":"Press Center (Zero loss) followed by isochromaticity measure. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cpf2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqh42","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6got5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8h8cr","text":"If values are off during this step, contact the facility manager for assistance. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rofq","text":"Go back to the Autofunction Tab in EPU and select Autostigmate in Thon ring magnification.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":66,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":76,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":66,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":76,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsf7r","text":"Followed by Autocoma on the same magnification. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1u1r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"al15h","text":"Using TEMUI, put it the objective lens and redo Autostigmate in Thon ring magnification. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":48,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":74,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":64,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":74,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6fhj1","text":"Go to EPU, select the Atlas Tab and start atlas collection. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8b9bh","text":"Once Atlas was collected, go to the EPU Tab and set up your session selecting the type of grid and type of acquisition. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vufj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vsj7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"anl4t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6gcgf","text":"Accurate mode will yield ~40-50 micrographs/hour compared to Faster mode at ~150-300 micrographs/hour. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2kkcf","text":"For gold grids, both holey carbon and holey gold work. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2k43","text":"To set up collection select squares from the atlas in square selection task.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8ev8","text":"Once squares are selected, go to hole selection task and press auto-eucentric on the first square. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"j39i","text":"After auto-eucentric, press measure holes and measure the holes on the square. (measuring the holes only has to be done once).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"536u1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7o4mn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9q23h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15q05","text":"Continue auto-eucentric and brush selection with the next squares. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3uu4h","text":"Use the selection brush to remove areas that will not be collected. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"215pd","text":"Move to hole that will not be used for collection and select the Template definition task, and add focus, drift outside the hole and target inside the hole.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j7md","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vsm1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cr8o1","text":"Check template using the Template execution task. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6f41n","text":"Depending on the microscope, you could add more than 1 target per hole. This is also dependent on the ice-thickness of your sample.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5t07p","text":"Go to Automated Acquistion task and start collection.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2d2r5","text":"Move to an area that is not broken using the atlas magnification in the Preparation Tab. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":45,"length":19},{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hu48","text":"Select the Autofunction Tab and select Beam alignment by beam tilt in the hole eucentric height magnification. Followed by Autofocus in autofocus magnification. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":27},{"style":"bold","offset":74,"length":35},{"style":"bold","offset":123,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":136,"length":23},{"style":"italic","offset":74,"length":35},{"style":"italic","offset":136,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Quick guide to use EPU for Cryo-em data collection

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"d6ptl","text":"Handle liquid nitrogen with gloves and face shields equipped all the time","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
